snippet: Like many others, Ruth French finds herself grappling with her spouse’s frontotemporal dementia, a group of brain diseases that eat away at personality and language.
abstract: Tens of thousands of Americans suffer from frontotemporal dementia, little-known and poorly understood group of brain diseases that eat away at personality and language; researchers have begun making important discoveries about the biomedical and genetic defects that cause some forms of the disease, and have for the first time identified drugs that may be able to treat it (Series: The Vanishing Mind).
lead_paragraph: Like many others, Ruth French finds herself grappling with her spouse’s frontotemporal dementia, a group of brain diseases that eat away at personality and language.

headline.seo: A Rare Form of Dementia Tests a Vow of ‘for Better, for Worse’
headline.main: When Illness Makes a Spouse a Stranger
headline.print_headline: When Illness Makes a Spouse a Stranger
